issue.title: some problem for networkserver.sendtoall
some problem for networkserver.sendtoall

comment.body: Closing this - not a bug and was answered in Discord.

issue.title: some problem for networkserver.sendtoall

comment.body:
You are not having any problems with Cilent's connection or not. I am guessing that it cannot make this function work because it has made the necessary adjustments and installation in the mirror awake function.
So, even if the client is not connected, this function works because this function sends messages to all existing clients.

issue.title: some problem for networkserver.sendtoall

comment.body:
I'm not 100% sure but I think Awake() is a bad place to place network code as it may be called before Mirror is fully initialized. 

Going from memory which might be incorrect, you might want to consider OnStartClient or another overridable function. That would ensure Mirror is initialized and synchronized up.

release.name: v82.8.1
release.body:
## [82.8.1](https://github.com/MirrorNetworking/Mirror/compare/v82.8.0...v82.8.1) (2023-10-27)


### Bug Fixes

* LatencySimulation now always applies latency to both channels. Fixes hard to debug issues where [SyncVar/Command/Rpc]s would be way off while NetworkTime.time was fine, due to latency being applied to only one channel. ([#3627](https://github.com/MirrorNetworking/Mirror/issues/3627)) ([9fe1d06](https://github.com/MirrorNetworking/Mirror/commit/9fe1d06ac0e10c17f327dd8514b53238da3e1239))

issue.title: some problem for networkserver.sendtoall

commits.message:
fix: LatencySimulation now always applies latency to both channels. Fixes hard to debug issues where [SyncVar/Command/Rpc]s would be way off while NetworkTime.time was fine, due to latency being applied to only one channel. (#3627)

* fix: LatencySimulation now always applies latency to both channels. Fixes hard to debug issues where [SyncVar/Command/Rpc]s would be way off while NetworkTime.time was fine, due to latency being applied to only one channel.

* this too
if we can't sample, give detailed error and hard correct if necessary
fix corrections not saving corrected history positions. fixes corrected line displacements, feels much more stable / on rails
fix desyncs because server stopped broadcasting when idle
fix: always record current state when recieving new state to fix received state behing newer than history (but potentially before current)
fix: if client is ahead (when 0ms latency), still hard correct to not get out of sync
if ahead, only correct if off by threshold
fix not drawing when not iterating on 0 latency

fix: LatencySimulation now always applies latency to both channels. Fixes hard to debug issues where [SyncVar/Command/Rpc]s would be way off while NetworkTime.time was fine, due to latency being applied to only one channel. (#3627)

* this too
